$autoinc_string

$autoinc_string : string

The string used for SQLite autoincrement data types.

This is different for versions 2 and 3 of SQLite.

Type

string

setPdo()

setPdo(\PDO $pdo) : void

Sets the PDO connection object; typically used when a shared PDO object already exists in a legacy context.

Note that if you use setPdo(), the pre- and post-connect method hooks will not be called.

Parameters

\PDO $pdo

The PDO object.

prepare()

prepare(string $text, array $bind) : \PDOStatement

Creates a prepared PDOStatement and binds data values to placeholders.

PDO itself is touchy about binding values. If you attempt to bind a value that does not have a corresponding placeholder, PDO will error. This method checks the query text to find placeholders and binds only data values that have placeholders in the text.

Similarly, PDO won't bind an array value. This method checks to see if the data to be bound is an array; if it is, the array is quoted and replaced into the text directly instead of binding it.

Parameters

string $text

The text of the SQL query.
array $bind

The values to bind (or quote) into the PDOStatement.

Returns

\PDOStatement

Inherited from
\Aura\Sql\Connection\AbstractConnection

Tags

todo

fetchAll(string|\Aura\Sql\Query\AbstractQuery $query, array $bind, callable $callable) : array

array

fetchAssoc()

fetchAssoc(string $query, array $bind, callable $callable) : array

Fetches an associative array of all rows from the database; the rows are represented as associative arrays. The array of all rows is keyed on the first column of each row.

N.b.: if multiple rows have the same first column value, the last row with that value will override earlier rows.

Parameters

string $query

The text of the SQL statement, optionally with named placeholders.
array $bind

An associative array of data to bind to the named placeholders.
callable $callable

A callable to be applied to each of the rows to be returned.

Returns

array

Inherited from
\Aura\Sql\Connection\AbstractConnection

Tags

todo

quote()

quote(mixed $val) : string

Safely quotes a value for an SQL statement.

If an array is passed as the value, the array values are quoted and then returned as a comma-separated string; this is useful for generating IN() lists.

Parameters

mixed $val

The value to quote.

Returns

string —

An SQL-safe quoted value (or a string of separated-and-quoted values).

Inherited from
\Aura\Sql\Connection\AbstractConnection

Tags

todo

quoteInto()

quoteInto(string $text, mixed $bind) : mixed

Quotes a value and places into a piece of text at a placeholder; the placeholder is a question-mark.

Parameters

string $text

The text with placeholder(s).
mixed $bind

The data value(s) to quote.

Returns

mixed —

An SQL-safe quoted value (or string of separated values) placed into the original text.

Inherited from
\Aura\Sql\Connection\AbstractConnection
See also

Tags

todo

quoteMulti()

quoteMulti(array $list, string $sep) : string

Quote multiple text-and-value pieces.

The placeholder is a question-mark; all placeholders will be replaced with the quoted value. For example ...

$list = [
     "WHERE date > ?"   => '2005-01-01',
     "  AND date < ?"   => '2005-02-01',
     "  AND type IN(?)" => ['a', 'b', 'c'],
];

$safe = $sql->quoteMulti($list);

// $safe = "WHERE date > '2005-01-02'
//          AND date < 2005-02-01
//          AND type IN('a','b','c')"

}}

Parameters

array $list

A series of key-value pairs where the key is the placeholder text and the value is the value to be quoted into it. If the key is an integer, it is assumed that the value is piece of literal text to be used and not quoted.
string $sep

Return the list pieces separated with this string (for example ' AND ').

Returns

string —

An SQL-safe string composed of the list keys and quoted values.

Inherited from
\Aura\Sql\Connection\AbstractConnection

Tags

todo

quoteName()

quoteName(string $spec) : string|array

Quotes a single identifier name (table, table alias, table column, index, sequence).

If the name contains ' AS ', this method will separately quote the parts before and after the ' AS '.

If the name contains a space, this method will separately quote the parts before and after the space.

If the name contains a dot, this method will separately quote the parts before and after the dot.

Parameters

string $spec

The identifier name to quote.

Returns

string|array —

The quoted identifier name.

Inherited from
\Aura\Sql\Connection\AbstractConnection
See also

Tags

todo

quoteNamesIn()

quoteNamesIn(string $text) : string|array

Quotes all fully-qualified identifier names ("table.col") in a string, typically an SQL snippet for a SELECT clause.

Does not quote identifier names that are string literals (i.e., inside single or double quotes).

Looks for a trailing ' AS alias' and quotes the alias as well.

Parameters

string $text

The string in which to quote fully-qualified identifier names to quote.

Returns

string|array —

The string with names quoted in it.

Inherited from
\Aura\Sql\Connection\AbstractConnection
See also

Tags

todo

Returns

int —

The number of rows affected, typically 1.

update()

update(string $table, array $cols, string $cond, array $bind) : int

Updates a table with specified data based on WHERE conditions.

Parameters

string $table

The table to update.
array $cols

An associative array where the key is the column name and the value is the value to use for that column.
string $cond

Conditions for a WHERE clause.
array $bind

Additional data to bind to the query; these are not part of the update, and note that the $cols values will take precedence over these additional values.

Returns

int —

The number of rows affected.

Inherited from
\Aura\Sql\Connection\AbstractConnection

splitName()

splitName(string $name) : array

Splits an identifier name into two parts, based on the location of the first dot.

Parameters

string $name

The identifier name to be split.

Returns

array —

An array of two elements; element 0 is the parts before the dot, and element 1 is the part after the dot. If there was no dot, element 0 will be null and element 1 will be the name as given.

Inherited from
\Aura\Sql\Connection\AbstractConnection
